member.name: T:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.Testing.NoOpCheckpointer
member.summary: NoOpCheckpointer is used in EventDataGeneratorStreamProvider ecosystem to replace the default Checkpointer which requires a back end storage. In EventHubDataGeneratorStreamProvider, it is generating EventData on the fly when receiver pull messages from the queue, which means it doesn't support recoverable stream, hence check pointing won't bring much value there. So a checkpointer with no ops should be enough.

member.name: T:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.IEventHubPartitionLocation
member.summary: Location of a message within an EventHub partition

member.name: P:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.IEventHubPartitionLocation.EventHubOffset
member.summary: Offset of the message within an EventHub partition

member.name: P:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.IEventHubPartitionLocation.SequenceNumber
member.summary: EventHub sequence id of the message

member.name: T:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.EventHubSequenceToken
member.summary: Event Hub messages consist of a batch of application layer events, so EventHub tokens contain three pieces of information. EventHubOffset - this is a unique value per partition that is used to start reading from this message in the partition. SequenceNumber - EventHub sequence numbers are unique ordered message IDs for messages within a partition. The SequenceNumber is required for uniqueness and ordering of EventHub messages within a partition. event Index - Since each EventHub message may contain more than one application layer event, this value indicates which application layer event this token is for, within an EventHub message. It is required for uniqueness and ordering of application layer events within an EventHub message.

member.name: P:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.EventHubSequenceToken.EventHubOffset
member.summary: Offset of the message within an EventHub partition

member.name: M:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.EventHubSequenceToken.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: EventHub offset within the partition from which this message came.
EventHub sequenceNumber for this message.
Index into a batch of events, if multiple events were delivered within a single EventHub message.

member.name: M:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.EventHubSequenceToken.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current object.

member.name: T:Orleans.ServiceBus.Providers.EventHubSequenceTokenV2
member.summary: Event Hub messages consist of a batch of application layer events, so EventHub tokens contain three pieces of information. EventHubOffset - this is a unique value per partition that is used to start reading from this message in the partition. SequenceNumber - EventHub sequence numbers are unique ordered message IDs for messages within a partition. The SequenceNumber is required for uniqueness and ordering of EventHub messages within a partition. event Index - Since each EventHub message may contain more than one application layer event, this value indicates which application layer event this token is for, within an EventHub message. It is required for uniqueness and ordering of application layer events within an EventHub message.

member.summary: Deletes the Azure table.

member.name: M:Orleans.Streaming.EventHubs.AzureTableDataManager`1.CreateTableEntryAsync(`0)
member.summary: Create a new data entry in the Azure table (insert new, not update existing). Fails if the data already exists.
member.param: Data to be inserted into the table.
member.returns: Value promise with new Etag for this data entry after completing this storage operation.

member.name: M:Orleans.Streaming.EventHubs.AzureTableDataManager`1.UpsertTableEntryAsync(`0)
member.summary: Inserts a data entry in the Azure table: creates a new one if does not exists or overwrites (without eTag) an already existing version (the "update in place" semantics).
member.param: Data to be inserted or replaced in the table.
member.returns: Value promise with new Etag for this data entry after completing this storage operation.

member.name: M:Orleans.Streaming.EventHubs.AzureTableDataManager`1.MergeTableEntryAsync(`0,System.String)
member.summary: Merges a data entry in the Azure table.
member.param: Data to be merged in the table.
ETag to apply.
member.returns: Value promise with new Etag for this data entry after completing this storage operation.

members.member:
Updates a data entry in the Azure table: updates an already existing data in the table, by using eTag. Fails if the data does not already exist or of eTag does not match.
Data to be updated into the table. /// ETag to use. Value promise with new Etag for this data entry after completing this storage operation.

member.name: M:Orleans.Streaming.EventHubs.AzureTableDataManager`1.DeleteTableEntryAsync(`0,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an already existing data in the table, by using eTag. Fails if the data does not already exist or if eTag does not match.
member.param: Data entry to be deleted from the table.
ETag to use.
member.returns: Completion promise for this storage operation.

member.name: M:Orleans.Streaming.EventHubs.AzureTableDataManager`1.ReadSingleTableEntryAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Read a single table entry from the storage table.
member.param: The partition key for the entry.
The row key for the entry.
member.returns: Value promise for tuple containing the data entry and its corresponding etag.

member.name: M:Orleans.Streaming.EventHubs.AzureTableDataManager`1.ReadAllTableEntriesForPartitionAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Read all entries in one partition of the storage table. NOTE: This could be an expensive and slow operation for large table partitions!
member.param: The key for the partition to be searched.
member.returns: Enumeration of all entries in the specified table partition.

member.summary: Read all entries in the table. NOTE: This could be a very expensive and slow operation for large tables!

member.returns: Completion promise for this storage operation.

member.returns: True if this exception means the data being read was not present in Azure table storage

member.name: M:Orleans.Streaming.EventHubs.AzureTableUtils.EvaluateException(System.Exception,System.Net.HttpStatusCode@,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Examine a storage exception, and if applicable extracts the HTTP status code, and REST error code if getRESTErrors=true.
member.param: Exception to be examined.
Output HTTP status code if applicable, otherwise HttpStatusCode.Unused (306)
When getRESTErrors=true, will output REST error code if applicable, otherwise null
Whether REST error code should also be examined / extracted.
member.returns: Returns true if HTTP status code and REST error were extracted.

member.name: M:Orleans.Streaming.EventHubs.AzureTableUtils.IsRetriableHttpError(System.Net.HttpStatusCode,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified HTTP status / error code is returned in a transient / retriable error condition

member.returns: true if this is a transient / retriable error condition
